Gentlemen,

I hope this is not too crass a question, but I need some sugges=
tions as to wholesale and retail values of Shingunto and Kaigunto.  I have =
recently be contacted by a gentleman who inherited some 3 dozen Japanese sw=
ords from a relative.  These are WW-2 bring backs, and still in the origina=
l shipping crates.  Most of the swords are in gunto or kaigunto mounts, and=
 I haven't had the opportunity to inspect them yet in person.  From the dig=
ital images he sent me the swords seem genuine enough.  There are a few par=
ade sabers present, and some bukezukuri mounts as well.

I normally have no=
thing to do with gunto and could use some guidelines, please.  What would b=
e a fair purchase value (wholesale) for common gunto and kaigunto?  What ar=
e they selling for (retail?)  I am thinking of trying to get the whole lot,=
 and then sell off the ones I don't need, if that is feasible.  If not, the=
n I will try to just negotitiate for the older swords in the batch.  Then a=
gain, the whole deal may fall through.

If some of you active traders out t=
here wouldn't mind sharing some insight, I would appreciate it.  If you thi=
nk this is something that should be discussed privately, please respond dir=
ectly to my personal email address, and not back to the list. (in other wor=
ds, just don't hit the "reply" button.

I thank you for your guidance.

Bob=
